subject: Re: Hearing Your Name Called Outloud.
author: v1230mail
full_text:
--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, <JeremyRobertHuber@...> wrote:
>
> Hello Rhonda and Everyone,
> 
> I have heard my name called out loud before, but it was not an EVP
situation it was after my first girlfriend died. I was 17. She was 15.
She had had her second kidney transplant a few months earlier and died
of gas gangrene.
> 
> She died at 3:15 PM and I felt it. I knew that she had died. It is
very difficult to explain, but I knew that she was gone. So, it wasn't
surprising to me when I got home from school and my eldest sister was
on the phone telling my Mother that Rena had died.
> 
> My Mother had moved us to Texas from Oklahoma a few months earlier.
I knew that Rena wasn't doing good as she was before I left, but no
one expected her to die. She made a turn for the worse late that
morning and by 3:15 she was gone. 
> 
> Late that afternoon I took the Greyhound bus back to my hometown in
Oklahoma. When I got to my sisters house, it was around 1 am. My
sister is 18 years older than me, so I have a niece that is a year
younger than me. My niece and I both heard Rena call my name and I
then heard her call my name again a little later before I went to bed.
That night after I had gone to sleep, it woke me up as I felt someone
sit on the side of my bed. I knew it was Rena telling me she was okay,
but this was before I knew anything about the paranormal, so I was a
bit scared to open my eyes and see her. 
> 
> She was my first love and I am hoping that I will hear from her
someday via EVP/ITC.
> 
> I consider myself very blessed to of heard her call my name and sit
beside me to let me know she was okay. 
> 
> Wishing everyone a wonderful weekend.
> 
> Jeremy 
> New York, New York
>
